forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Tutorial #63 combines Tutorial #30 (XP) and #43 (Win7/Vista) into one. So use #63 as I said in my post.  
If you get Error 15: file not found, then you have not used the correct filename.  

Try the menu entry and the when it goes back to the menu again after the error:  
press **C**   
then type **ls /**   
you should see the files in the root of the USB drive listed  
then type **ls /_ISO/Windows/** and you should see the Win7 iso listed.  

I have tested this many times on many different systems and it does work - so you have done something wrong.  
You just need to follow the instructions. ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)  
If you want help with it, please give details - like what menu you are using when you get the error!
